title: Looking for a "Classy Summer Luau" Typeface
content:
I am working on a brand for a summer-long church event. The brand theme is as follows (in order of importance):

1. Compliment an Old World themed room (Think Tuscany)  
2. Contain Palm Trees in the imagery  
3. Have a luau feel to it  
4. Fun, family, summertime

Don't know if that helps paint a picture in your mind, but my issue is finding a typeface to anchor this brand design. Any thoughts or suggestions are welcome.

Thanks in advance!

Brent
author: BrentSpore

comments.content: Finding stuff that meets #2-4 is easy. Adding #1 makes it a tough task.

Don't I know it! I think the tiki fonts are pretty good, but was thinking something with a little less of a cliche feel to it because of #1. Maybe just a nice clean semi-serif (not Rotis, but something like it) that looks travel-ish. Put it with the imagery and that might fit the bill?

What if you replaced "luau" with "old Hawaii"?

What about [MVB Gryphius](http://web.archive.org/web/20150124020128/http:/www.mvbfonts.com/html/fonts/gryphius/pk_gryphius.htm) or [MVB Celestia Antiqua Two](http://web.archive.org/web/20150124020128/http:/www.mvbfonts.com/html/fonts/celestia/pk_celestia_two.htm) or [Olduvai](http://web.archive.org/web/20150124020128/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=UMT0000054)?
imho ITC Oldricium really gets where you wanted.

Tiffany has a good point. Dark wood and muted, "sun-bleached" colors...They say "old Hawaii" and would work in a dark paneled "Tuscan" room.

[Friki Tiki](http://web.archive.org/web/20150124020128/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=JBT0000020)

Tiff, i'm surprised you didn't include [MVB Sirenne](http://web.archive.org/web/20150124020128/http:/www.mvbfonts.com/html/fonts/sirenne/pk_sirenne_six.htm)

also similar:  
 [Nicolas Cochin](http://web.archive.org/web/20150124020128/http:/www.p22.com/lanston/products/cochin.html)

Great tip, Miss Tiffany! Thank you! These are really getting closer to what I had envisioned in my mind. Thankyou all so much! Here's a thought, I just whipped this together for discussion purposes. The font would be used in the "paper" sections in the middle. Any further thoughts?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150124020128im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Mockup_4633.jpg)
I like the concept but wish it had a little more color. I think of Hawaii, Hawaiian prints, Hawaiian cocktails as pretty lush and colorful.

Thanks to all! the mockup is now done, now I have to make this whole thing over in Hi-Res. I really appreciate all your suggestions, they helped a lot. I ended up using Celestia Antiqua, they liked that best.
I wouldn't use Hawaiian cocktails for a church event...And I think bright colors would clash with the "Tuscan" look. Brent, I really like the color and feel of the design you posted.
